Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Drizzly \Driz"zly\, a. Characterized by small rain, or snow; moist and disagreeable. ``Winter's drizzly reign.'' --Dryden. [1913 Webster]
drizzly adj : wet with light rain; "a sad drizzly day"; "a wet drippy day" [syn: {drippy}]
